frameDefinitions: This frame concerns  words that express an Object's position on a scale, its Measurement, with respect to some attribute, its Dimension.
This frame contains words which describe the dimensional extent and Shape of a Substance.
The universe is considered through a teleological perspective and natural phenomena are seen to exist for the purpose of fulfilling some ultimate aim.
An Agent acts in such a way as to give the incorrect impression to observers that a particular State_of_affairs holds.
An Event is described in terms of the diversity of entities that are affected or considered in the Event.

This frame involves a static (primarily spatial) relationship between a Location and a Theme, in which the Theme is located in many or all subregions of the Location, and is thus construable as covering it.
frameExamples: She held a <t><fex name='Shape'>square</fex></t> of cloth .
The <t>PURPOSE</t> of the sun is to provide energy
Jordan <t>feigned</t> a love of jazz music to get her phone number .
The U.S. government believes that China has not revealed the full <t>scope</t> of its program.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the <fen>Dimension</fen> which is measured.  Most LUs in this frame incorporate the <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<fen>Object</fen> identifies the item which is measured along one of its <fen>Dimension</fen>s.
<fen>Measurement</fen> identifies the extent of the <fen>Object</fen> along the specified <fen>Dimension</fen>.
A <fen>Substance</fen> of which pieces can be extracted.
This is the <fen>Shape</fen> that the <fen>Substance</fen> is in.
An entity that was not created by a living thing that is conceptualized to exist to fulfill some <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> holds.
This is the entity which is copied. With verbs it is frequently expressed as an NP Object: Pat <t>falsified</t> <fex name='Original'>the papers</fex>.
The Copy produced by the Creator most commonly occurs as the External Argument of a predicative use of an adjective or noun target: <fex name='Copy'>The painting</fex> is a <t>fake</t>.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is a an event, a state, or a property that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants others to believe have occurred or hold.
The place in which the <fen>Agent</fen> feigns something.
The state-of-affairs that affects a set of entities.
The feature of an <fen>Salient_entity</fen> which is under discussion.
The entity which enables or causes the <fen>Event</fen> being judged.

The <fen>Theme</fen> in this frame is the object which is described as standing in some spatial relation to a particular <fen>Location</fen>.  <fen>Theme</fen> typically occurs as the External Argument or, with passives, as a PP Complement headed by 'with' or 'by'.
<fen>Location</fen> is the entity or area with respect to which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s spatial arrangement is described.  This frame element generally occurs as an NP Object.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies the <fen>Location</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The  new vase is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
<fex>The  new vase</fex> is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
The  new vase is <fex>5 cm</fex> in circumference at the top.
A year after <fex>Audrey Seiler</fex> faked her own kidnapping while at college in Wisconsin, her lawyer says she's getting help and paying restitution.
A college student who staged <fex>her own disappearance</fex> last month will try to reach a plea agreement and avoid trial on charges she obstructed officers.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Michigan City Area Chamber of Commerce
the Michigan City Economic Development Corp.
